page.title: 06Fruit Farm at Evesbatch
page.content: A family farm bought in 1934 changed over from sheep and cattle to {vegetables}during the second world war and, since 1950, is growing {fruit.} Mr. Porter now grows cherries, cider apples, blackcurrants and winter wheat. He now has 140 acres; 33 for winter wheat, 6 for cherries, 21 for cider apples and 10 for buildings, roads and lakes. He has high inputs and high outputs. Their{yearly routine}starts in april. They spray the blackcurrants every two weeks. They also spray apples and cherries. In june-july they harvest blackcurants and cherries. They take three weeks to pick. In august they harvest wheat. In september-december they pick apples and december-march they prune them. The{cider apples}are sold to Bulmers in Hereford.
